page.title: 05THE FAUNA.
page.content: The animals that can be seen in the fields are mostly domesticated animals such as cows sheep and horses. One farmer also has some pigs in a field, but most keep them in stys. There is also one large poultry farm at{ {Northowram}where most birds are kept inside either in batteries or in deep litter. The wild animals to be found include, rabbits, hares and grey squirrels,hedgehogs,fieldmice and voles. There are also several foxes but these are rarely seen, although we often see their droppings in their sprainting places. There are many birds to be seen in this area, but our favourite is the kestrel which hovers over our school. There is also an abundance of insect life, including many varities of butterfly, and we also have frogs breeding in our pond.
